entities.name: AntigravityPanel
observations: A VS Code extension toolkit for Antigravity IDE users, providing quota monitoring, cache management, and system visualization.
Includes 'Auto-Accept' (Hands-free Mode) feature for automatically approving agent steps and terminal commands.

entities.name: Brain Directory
observations: Contains sub-folders for each Task, each typically including a task.md file.
Maps directly to the physical path ~/.gemini/antigravity/brain/.
Primary target for space/cache management within the Antigravity toolkit.

entities.name: Cache Management
observations: Includes automated cleaning of old tasks based on size or count.
Synchronizes deletions in brain/ with corresponding files in conversations/ directory.

entities.name: LocalizationStrategy
observations: All hover tooltips, settings descriptions, and system notifications must be fully localized in all 13 supported languages to provide clear functional explanations.
All user-facing technical UI labels and command titles (e.g., 'Restart Service', 'Rules', 'MCP', 'Auto-Accept') must remain in English across all supported locales to maintain technical consistency.
The project supports 13 languages: English, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Japanese, Korean, German, Spanish, French, Italian, Polish, Brazilian Portuguese, Russian, and Turkish.

entities.name: Projects Directory (Code Contexts)
observations: Deleting items here triggers a re-index of the project the next time the Agent enters it.
Managed via getCodeContexts() and deleteContext() methods in CacheService.
Represented as the 'Code Tracker' section in the sidebar UI.
Stores active code context indices, project snapshots, and tracking data generated by Antigravity's Code Tracker.
